page.title: 13THE ISLE CONT'D.
page.content: Within the large,sweeping meander of the severn which dominates much of the centre of our area,is an isolated area known as "the Isle".It is almost entirely surrounded by the river and must once have formed an attractive defensive site.Within it is a moated site of unknown date and origin,which has the ruins of a chapel close by. Presumably,it was a fortified manor with its own chapel.Today,the area is farmed by the Isle farm and beyond that a large lake with an attractive Georgian style country house of modest proportions.
